intro: Bupleurum triradiatum var. adamsii, commonly known as the Adams' angelica, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and herbal collections.
